item.title: REPLACED delayed to spring 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Xbox Series

Development update trailer released.

Science-fiction retro-futuristic action platformer REPLACED will launch for Xbox Series and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store in spring 2026, a delay from its previously planned 2025 release window, publisher Thunderful Games and developer Sad Cat Studios announced. An Xbox One version is seemingly no longer planned.

The new release window was revealed as part of a new development update, where Sad Cat Studios talks through the game’s progress and shares behind the scenes footage showcasing the game’s evolution over the years.

“We know that our community is incredibly excited to play REPLACED and it’s no secret that it’s taken longer than we initially thought to deliver that to you all—we apologize for that,” said game director Yura Zhdanovich in a press release. “We’ve always been trying to do what’s right for the project, which in turn, means delivering to you a truly special experience. The good news is that we now are very close to finishing production and REPLACED will be coming to PC and Xbox Series X|S in spring 2026.”

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the game, via Thunderful Games:

REPLACED is set in an alternate 1980s America, featuring free-flow action combat and a deep, dystopian story. You play as R.E.A.C.H. – an artificial intelligence trapped in a human body against its own will, striving to adjust to human life, in and around Phoenix-City. Outlaws are rife in a society that has sustained lasting damage and taken a turn for the worse, following a catastrophic nuclear event. Everything is ruled by corruption and greed and the ones in power see humans and their organs as nothing more than currency. REPLACED focuses on a single-player experience, with a mix of cinematic platforming, pixel art and free-flow action combat.

Watch the development update and two new gameplay videos below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery. A final trailer is due out later in 2025.

item.title: Phantom Breaker: Battle Grounds Ultimate DLC character Kaho Shibuya launches September 4
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Humble baker by day and a magical girl by destiny.

Phantom Breaker: Battle Grounds Ultimate downloadable content character Kaho Shibuya, based on the real-life Japanese pop culture personality and cosplayer, will launch on September 4, developer Rocket Panda Games announced.

Here is an overview of the content, via Rocket Panda Games:

About

A daughter of a humble baker by day and a magical girl by destiny, Kaho’s bread-fueled justice comes to life with a freshly-baked moveset that’s as charming as it is chaotic. Whether flinging baguette blasts or unleashing croissant combos, she’s ready to roll… and rise.

Set against the vibrant backdrop of Los Angeles, California the downloadable content package includes:

  • One new playable character Kaho Shibuya, a magical girl with the powers of cuteness and bread, available to use on Co-Op and Battlegrounds Mode. Shibuya herself voices the character in both English and Japanese.
  • Four new enemy mob characters to battle through on the new stage.
  • A brand-new stage set in a fictional “LA,” dressed up for Anime Expo season available on Co-Op Mode.
  • New special in-game stage background featuring the Phantom Breakers’ new single, “WiSH” with Shibuya appearing as a guest vocalist.
  • In-stage Collaboration Camoes with LA local food truck, Okamoto Kitchen and 3D latte art shop from Japan, Latte Pocket.

Phantom Breaker: Battle Grounds Ultimate is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.

item.title: Corpse Party Tetralogy Pack coming west in 2025
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Four-game horror adventure collection.

XSEED Games will release four-game horror adventure collection Corpse Party Tetralogy Pack for Switch in 2025 in the west, the publisher announced.

Corpse Party Tetralogy Pack first launched for Switch on August 7 in Japan with English language support. It includes the 2021 re-release of Corpse Party, Corpse Party: Book of Shadows, Corpse Party: Sweet Sachiko’s Hysteric Birthday Bash, and Corpse Party: Blood Drive.

Here is an overview of the collection, via XSEED Games:

About

Heavenly Host Elementary. Once, it was the pride of the town and one of the most respected and desired schools in the region. Until the day Sachiko Shinozaki died, cursing the grounds forever more. Now Heavenly Host Elementary exists in a plane beyond the mortal realm, and where once it was a place of optimism and joy, now there is nothing but tragedy, ruin, and horror.

From its origins retold in Corpse Party (2021), where a friendship ritual gone wrong springs terror on a new generation of students, to a deeper exploration of the pain and suffering of generations of students in Corpse Party: Book of Shadows, with a special detour to an invite-only birthday party from hell in Corpse Party: Sweet Sachiko’s Hysteric Birthday Bash, and the chilling conclusion of the saga in Corpse Party: Blood Drive, you’ll uncover every last truth held within the walls of Heavenly Host Elementary… if you survive.

Fifteen years after reintroducing fans on consoles to Heavenly Host Elementary, a tragically cursed school haunted by the pain of the past, the Corpse Party series returns with a brand-new collection of the iconic saga that made its bloody mark on fans around the world. Available exclusively on Nintendo Switch, the Corpse Party Tetralogy Pack bundles four nightmarish narratives united by this keystone of creepiness. Go back to where this haunting adventure began in the modernized original Corpse Party (2021) and its twisted sequel Corpse Party: Book of Shadows, then experience the devilishly fun Corpse Party: Sweet Sachiko’s Hysteric Birthday Bash, never-before-released on consoles in the west. If you manage to survive all that, the stunning conclusion of the “Heavenly Host” arc awaits in Corpse Party: Blood Drive!

Whether you’re new to the Corpse Party franchise, or a seasoned veteran of Sachiko’s blood-curdling frights, this collection is a celebration of what makes this series so memorable and shouldn’t be missed.

Key Features

  • Four Terrifying Tales, One Complete Package – Play through the entirety of the “Heavenly Host” saga and experience four terrifying tales of intertwined fates in one convenient package.
  • Extreme Japanese Horror – Explore the halls of Heavenly Host Elementary in a riveting mystery full of vengeful spirits, psychological horrors, and shocking secrets. The visual novel storytelling unfolds in the original Japanese voiceover with English subtitles.
  • New for Nintendo Switch – Book of Shadows and Sweet Sachiko’s Hysteric Birthday Bash will both be available on Nintendo Switch for the first time!
  • High-Definition Scares – Each title has been optimized for high-definition audio and video, making this collection great for first-time players, and a startling new way to play for longtime fans.

Included Games

  • Corpse Party (2021) – A friendship ritual gone awry transports high school student Ayumi Shinozaki and her friends to an alternate reality version of a tragedy-stricken institution that stood on the site of their own school long ago. As the vengeful spirits of elementary school students threaten their lives and their sanity, their only hope of survival–much less escape–is to uncover the chilling details surrounding the murders of those trapped before them.
  • Corpse Party: Book of Shadows – An anthology series that serves as a Corpse Party sequel, prequel, midquel, and alternate universe tale all in one. Corpse Party: Book of Shadows builds upon the events of the first game, exploring or re-exploring past incidents, characters, and points of view, and allowing the player to escape many of the deaths that occurred previously, thus steering them toward all-new (albeit not necessarily better) outcomes.
  • Corpse Party: Sweet Sachiko’s Hysteric Birthday Bash – A (surprisingly) canonical “midquel” to Corpse Party and Corpse Party: Book of Shadows, taking place sometime during the course of those games, Corpse Party: Sweet Sachiko’s Hysteric Birthday Bash recounts the bizarre events of vengeful ghost girl Sachiko Shinozaki’s one-of-a-kind birthday party held in the otherworldly school where so many lives have been lost in previous games: Heavenly Host Elementary. Surviving to the end will require thinking like Sachiko and making the choices that will please her the most…but with the fewest casualties.
  • Corpse Party: Blood Drive – Set two months after Corpse Party: Book of Shadows, Corpse Party: Blood Drive is the definitive conclusion to the long-running Heavenly Host story arc. Featuring dynamic lighting, detailed environments, and new gameplay systems, this is a Japanese horror experience not to be missed!

item.title: CHAOS;HEAD / CHAOS;CHILD Love chu chu!! DOUBLE PACK announced for Switch
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Due out on November 27 in Japan.

MAGES. has announced CHAOS;HEAD / CHAOS;CHILD Love chu chu!! DOUBLE PACK for Switch. It will launch on November 27 in Japan for 7,480 yen.

A limited edition will also be available for 9,680 yen, which includes a special box illustrated by Mutsumi Sasaki featuring Serika Onoe and Rimi Sakihata in swimsuits, and a soundtrack DVD featuring MP3 and FLAC versions of music from all four titles in the series (including CHAOS;HEAD NOAH and CHAOS;CHILD).

As its title implies, CHAOS;HEAD / CHAOS;CHILD Love chu chu!! DOUBLE PACK includes the Science Adventure series spin-off romance visual novels CHAOS;HEAD Love Chu Chu and CHAOS;CHILD Love chu chu!!, originally released in 2010 and 2017, respectively.

Visit the official website here.

item.title: Koei Tecmo announces TGS 2025 lineup
item.content:encoded:
Hyrule Warriors, NINJA GAIDEN 4, and Nioh 3.

Koei Tecmo has opened its Tokyo Game Show 2025 website and announced its lineup of games for the event, which will run from September 25 to 28 at Makuhari Messe in Chiba, Japan.

The company’s lineup is as follows:

  • Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment (Switch 2) – Playable
  • NINJA GAIDEN 4 (PS5, Xbox Series, PC) – Playable
  • Nioh 3 (PS5, PC) – Playable

Further information about Koei Tecmo’s Tokyo Game Show 2025 plans will be announced at a later date.
